title-part.text: WORKING OF SCREWS, BOLT HEADS, OR NUTS, IN CONJUNCTION THEREWITH

reference.text: making helical grooves by turning B23B5/48, by milling B23C3/32, by forging, pressing, or hammering B21K1/56, by grinding B24B19/02; arrangements for copying or controlling B23Q; thread-forming by corrugating tubes B21D15/04, by rolling B21H3/02

note.note-paragraph: The term "thread cutting" is to be understood as including the use of tools similar both in form and in manner of use to thread-cutting tools, but without removing any material

title-part.text: on an external or internal cylindrical or conical surface, e.g. on recesses

reference.text: B23G1/16, B23G1/22, B23G1/32, B23G1/36 take precedence

title-part.text: specially adapted for making conical screws, e.g. wood-screws
Machines with a plurality of working spindles
specially adapted for making conical screws, e.g. wood-screws
Machines with a toothed cutter in the shape of a spur-gear of the like which is rotated to generate the thread profile as the work rotates
specially adapted for making conical screws, e.g. wood-screws
in holes of workpieces by taps
Machines with a plurality of working spindles
Machines specially designed for operating on pipes or tubes

reference.text: features of the threading tool per se B23G5/00
lubricating and cooling devices therefor B23G5/005; B23G1/265 takes precedence

CPC-specific-text.text: Tap wrenches having a V slot
Die wrenches having a cylindrical opening and a clamping screw
comprising tap wrench features with a V slot
Die and tap wrenches with a guiding part

reference.text: lubricating and cooling devices therefor B23G5/005

CPC-specific-text.text: Tap wrenches having a V slot
Die wrenches having a cylindrical opening and a clamping screw
comprising tap wrench features with a V slot

title-part.text: with means for adjusting the threading tool
without means for adjusting the threading tool, e.g. with die-stock
with a cutting bit moving in a closed path arranged eccentrically with respect to the axis of the rotating workpieces
with grinding discs guided along the workpiece in accordance with the pitch of the required thread
with grinding discs guided radially to the workpiece
Equipment or accessories specially designed for machines or devices for thread cutting

CPC-specific-text.text: comprising arrangements for reversing the rotation of the tool

title-part.text: for cutting thread by successive operations
for operating on pipes or tubes
Arrangements or accessories for enabling machine tools not specially designed only for thread cutting to be used for this purpose, e.g. arrangements for reversing the working spindle

CPC-specific-text.text: for enabling presses to be used for thread cutting

title-part.text: for withdrawing or resetting the threading tool
for repeatedly setting the treading tool in a predetermined working position
for compensating inaccuracies in the pitch of the lead-screw
for advancing or controlling the threading tool or the work by templates, cams, or the like
for cutting thread of variable pitch
for using several adjacently-arranged threading tools, e.g. using several chasers
for cutting thread of conical shape

CPC-specific-text.text: with means for removing the broken tap

title-part.text: combined with other tools, e.g. drills

reference.text: B23G5/182 takes precedence; screws which drill and tap F16B25/00

title-part.text: Forming thread by means of tools similar both in form and in manner of use to thread-cutting tools, but without removing any material

reference.text: features of machines or devices not specially adapted to the particular mode of forming the thread B23G1/00

title-part.text: Working screws, bolt heads, or nuts in conjunction with thread cutting, e.g. slotting screw heads or shanks, removing burrs from screw heads or shanks
Feeding or discharging mechanisms combined with, or arranged in, or specially adapted for use in connection with, thread-cutting machines

reference.text: for machines tools in general B23Q

title-part.text: Tools in which the shank and the cutting part are made from different materials or from separate components
Connections between parts of threading tools

reference.text: manually operated thread cutting devices with means for adjusting the threading tool B23G1/28

title-part.text: Threading tools comprising inserts for thread forming
Tools comprising means for forming threads by deformation
Tools comprising means for milling features other than the thread
Tools with cutting edges spaced unequally around the circumference
Tools having an end cap, e.g. for the distribution of cutting fluid
Threading tools having a conical form
Cutting edges that are rounded in the cross-sectional view of the cutting edge
Tools having a decreasing diameter in the direction of the shank from the tip
Tools having an increasing diameter in the direction of the shank from the tip
Tools having provision to produce threads of more than one type or size
Tools with shanks having a working end at each end of the shank
Tools with variable or different helix angles
Taps with more than one threading section, the threading sections being axially spaced from one another
Tools having a section of polygonal form, e.g. for the transmission of torque
Tools in which the pitch of the teeth is a multiple of the pitch of the thread being produced
Threads having a special form or profile not otherwise provided for
Materials of threading tools, workpieces or other structural elements
Details of equipment for threading other than threading tools, details of the threading process
Equipment for producing threaded component with a rotating disc to hold the components
Guiding devices with a pin affixable in a drilling chuck and with free rotation of the threading tool holder with respect to the pin
Guides for threading tools having a V-groove for location on cylindrical workpieces
Threading devices designed to be mounted in the tailstock of a lathe
Methods of threading not otherwise provided for
Threading equipment having an integrally incorporated driving motor
Tap or die wrenches with multiple locations for holding threading tools, e.g. for holding threading tools of different sizes
Producing or refurbishing threads for spark plugs or glow plugs
Thread whirling, i.e. production of a thread by means of an annular tool rotating about an axis not coincident with the axis of the thread being produced
